rules.rule: Helmholtz stripe effect follows sigmoid transition centered at W:H=0.52
rules.formula: sigmoid = 1 / (1 + exp(-(wh_ratio - 0.52) * 6.0)); effect = -5.8 + sigmoid * (15.37 - (-5.8))

rules.rule: Duty cycle modifier for stripe effects
rules.formula: duty_cycle_modifier = 0.6 + 0.4 * stripe_duty_cycle
rules.evidence: Thompson 2011: duty cycle 0.9 -> ~10% effect; duty cycle 0.1 -> ~4%

rules.rule: Comparison baseline reduction: H-stripes vs plain garment reduces effect by 70%
rules.formula: if baseline == 'none': effect *= 0.3
rules.evidence: Thompson Exp 3: horizontal vs PLAIN -> effect ~0 for moderate bodies

rules.rule: 3D viewing amplifies stripe effect by 1.84x
rules.formula: if viewing_3D: effect *= 1.84
rules.evidence: Thompson: 3D mannequin 10.7% vs 2D drawing 5.8%

rules.rule: Oppel-Kundt filler curve is non-monotonic: peaks at 8-12 fillers then declines
rules.formula: Inverted-U curve with maximum at 11-13 equispaced fillers (Wackermann 2010)

rules.rule: Luminance additive component: darker garment independently slims
rules.formula: luminance_effect = -3.5 * (1 - garment_luminance_normalized)

rules.rule: Stripe width: narrow stripes amplify Helmholtz more than wide stripes
rules.evidence: Thompson 2011: duty cycle 0.9 (narrow lines, wide gaps) -> up to 10.1%; 0.1 -> ~4%

rules.rule: Bright horizontal stripes on dark garment maximize perceived widening
rules.formula: irradiation expansion: +5-10% per stripe edge * stripe count; Oppel-Kundt: +3-7% at 8-12 stripes; Combined: +5-12%

rules.rule: Luminance-width relationship follows saturating sigmoid curve
rules.formula: sigmoid = 1/(1+exp(-0.08*(L_star-35))); if sigmoid<0.5: effect = -1.5*(1-2*sigmoid); else: effect = 0.8*(2*sigmoid-1)

rules.rule: Background luminance multiplier: dark backgrounds amplify slimming 7x
rules.evidence: Koutsoumpis Exp 3: dark bg 1.33% vs light bg 0.19% (7x ratio)

rules.rule: Body-width proportionality correction: wider bodies get smaller % slimming
rules.formula: width_correction = reference_width_ratio / body_width_ratio; reference = 0.40
rules.evidence: Edge contraction is absolute; % decreases for wider bodies

rules.rule: Grey perceived wider than white despite lower L* — hue anomaly

rules.rule: Monochromatic dressing (unbroken vertical column) reduces perceived width by ~1.5-5.0%
rules.formula: HVI on full outfit -> 5-10% height overestimation -> 1.5-5.0% width reduction via reciprocity factor (0.3-0.5% per 1%)

rules.rule: Color break at waist splits column, reducing height overestimation by 40-60%
rules.formula: Effective widening at break zone: +1-3% relative to monochromatic

rules.rule: Skin-garment contrast modifier: high contrast sharpens body boundary (+width), low blends (-width)
rules.formula: When deltaL > 60: +0.5-1.5% width. When deltaL < 30: boundary less salient. Net: < ±0.5%

rules.rule: Luminance contribution to Oppel-Kundt is 20-33% of total effect
rules.evidence: Wackermann 2012

rules.rule: Polarity asymmetry: bright-on-dark STRONGER expansion than dark-on-bright
rules.evidence: Wackermann 2012: negative polarity (bright on dark) = stronger Oppel-Kundt

rules.evidence: Day & Dickinson 1976; Biervliet 1896; Heymans 1896

rules.evidence: Standard horizontal shoulder seams, perpendicular pocket flaps are perceptually neutral

rules.rule: Pattern scale optimal zone: 5-15 repeats across body segment
rules.formula: < 3 repeats: BLOCK effect (-0.3); > 20 repeats: NOISE/Oppel-Kundt (-0.2); 5-15: optimal (+0.1)

rules.rule: Single pattern element > 20% of body segment width triggers figure-ground segregation

rules.rule: Diagonal lines decompose into H and V components by angle

rules.rule: Downward chevron creates Müller-Lyer contraction at apex
rules.formula: alpha=30deg: ~10% narrowing; 45deg: ~8%; 60deg: ~5%; 90deg: 0%

rules.evidence: Cundall & Guo 2017

rules.formula: L1: luminance + stripes_partial (synergy 1.44x, ceiling 1.01% on light bg); L2: adds to L1 at 0.92x attenuation (ceiling ±15.37%); L3: adds to L1+L2 at 0.97x; L4: aligned adds at 0.90x, conflicting 50/50 blend

rules.evidence: Koutsoumpis Exp 2

rules.rule: Level 1 ceiling: 1.01% on light background, scales to 3.03% on dark background
Background multiplier ranges from 0.15 (white) to 6.5 (very dark)
Percentage to score conversion is asymmetric

rules.rule: Color contrast at body transitions: white at waist-hip = double damage
rules.formula: irradiation expansion + attention drawn to widest zone
rules.evidence: Sidhu 2021: white clothing increased waist-hip fixation by 8-12%

rules.rule: Black at waist-hip = double duty: irradiation contraction + attention redirection away
rules.evidence: Sidhu 2021 + Koutsoumpis 2021

rules.rule: Confidence SD envelope increases in transition zone
rules.formula: Helmholtz zone: SD ≈ 3-4%; Transition zone: SD ≈ 5-7% (highest uncertainty); Reversal zone: SD ≈ 9.24% (Imai n=137)

V-neck elongation score = min(perceived_extension / 2.5, 1.0). Capped at 1.0.

V-neck bust framing: below dividing threshold = negative (draws eye to bust). Score branches by bust differential and fabric stretch.
Crew neck shortens perceived neck by ~1.0 inch. Creates horizontal line across upper chest.
Boat neck widens perceived shoulders by 1.5-3.0 inches. Width increase proportional to neckline width minus shoulder width.
Boat neck on inverted triangle: score = -0.70 - min(imbalance * 0.04, 0.25). Confidence 0.92 — well-understood bad pairing.
Square neckline angularizes face shape perception. Creates structured frame.
Turtleneck neck shortening: ~2.0 inches for full turtleneck; ~1.2 inches for mock neck.
Turtleneck REVERSAL for long necks: if perceived_neck_after >= 3.0in, neck_score is POSITIVE (0.10 to 0.75 based on original neck length)
Turtleneck collar volume factor: computed as neck_circ/13 * collar_height/3 * fabric_weight_factor. Amplifies upper body volume score.

Turtleneck monolithic column score by body type: apple=-0.35-(collar*0.10); hourglass+large_bust=-0.40-(collar*0.12); inverted_triangle=-0.30-(collar*0.08); plus_size=-0.25-extra_volume-(collar*0.10); rectangle=-0.10; pear=-0.15; default=-0.15-(collar*0.05)
Turtleneck petite amplification: if neck_score < 0, multiply by 1.20 to amplify negative.
Turtleneck tall + long neck (>= 4.5in): neck_score = max(current, 0.65). Ensures tall + long neck gets strong positive.
Sweetheart bust illusion: enhances perceived bust by 0.5-1.0 cup size via curved neckline framing.
Cowl neck adds volume at upper chest. Drape creates visual mass.
Off-shoulder exposure effect depends on shoulder width relative to body. Exposes shoulder-to-arm transition.
Wrap neckline is COMPOUND: 4 weighted components — V-elongation (0.25 weight), diagonal slimming (0.15), waist definition (0.45), bust accommodation (0.15)
Wrap diagonal slimming: base +0.20. Rectangle: +0.25 (creates shape differentiation). Apple: +0.15.
Wrap waist definition — hourglass peak: waist_definition >= 8in -> score 0.70; >= 6in -> 0.55; else 0.40
Wrap waist collapse on apple: WHR > 0.92 -> score -0.35 (tie adds bulk at widest); WHR > 0.88 -> -0.15; WHR > 0.85 -> +0.05; else +0.20
Wrap gaping risk: bust_differential >= 7 AND fabric_friction < 0.3 AND closure='tie' -> gaping_penalty = -0.50
Wrap on rectangle: waist_score = 0.35 (manufactures waist definition)
Wrap on petite + very slim (bust<32, waist<25): waist_score = 0.15, reduced from standard (panels may bunch)
Wrap plus size overlay: bust > 44in AND tie-only closure -> waist_score -= 0.25 (high gaping risk)
Sleeve termination scoring principle: arm appears as wide as where it's last visible. Score maps termination circumference to arm range: 0.0 ratio (narrowest) -> +0.80; 1.0 ratio (widest) -> -0.80.
Sleeve label to length mapping: sleeveless=0, cap=2.5, short=5.0, elbow=10.0, three_quarter=17.0, seven_eighth=19.0, long=23.0 inches from shoulder.
Sleeve danger zone score: -0.65 - (width_ratio - 0.8) * 1.0. Extra penalty for exact danger zone termination.
Sleeve forearm_narrow zone score: +0.75 + (1.0 - width_ratio) * 0.25. Bonus for optimal termination.
Sleeve shoulder_cap zone score: -0.30 - width_ratio * 0.30. Negative because creates 'ledge' effect.
Sleeve wrist zone score: +0.40. Covers everything — neutral-positive.
Plus size sleeve modifier: positive scores *= 1.15 (amplify benefits); negative scores *= 1.25 (amplify negatives, more at stake)
Apple sleeve modifier at danger zone: arm_width_score *= 1.20 (wider danger zone MORE damaging)
Goal 'showcase' + danger_zone + muscular body: REVERSAL — arm_width_score = +0.45 (danger zone frames muscle = positive)
3/4 sleeve translation: on petite arm < 21in, standard 17in reaches WRIST, not forearm. On tall arm > 25in, ends at mid-forearm, 2-3in above optimal.
Puff sleeve widening by volume: fitted=0.5in, slim=1.0in, moderate=2.5in, voluminous=4.0in of shoulder widening.
Puff on inverted triangle: score = -0.70 - min(new_imbalance * 0.04, 0.25). Confidence 0.92. EXTREME REVERSAL — do not recommend.
Puff on pear: correction_pct = widening / shoulder_deficit. Score = 0.50 + correction_pct * 0.40 (range 0.50 to 0.90). Peak use case.
Puff on petite pear: scale_penalty = max(0, (63 - height) / 20) up to 0.30 at 5'0. Neck compression if neck_length < 2.5in: additional -0.30.
Puff on hourglass: if balance_after > 1.5in, creates inverted triangle effect. Score = -0.30 - (balance_after - 1.5) * 0.15. DD+ bust compounds: additional -0.25.
Puff on rectangle: waist_taper_illusion = widening * 0.6. Score = 0.45 + min(taper/4.0, 0.25) (range 0.45 to 0.70).
Puff on petite alone: scale_ratio = widening / height. If > 0.045: score 0.20; > 0.035: 0.35; else 0.50. Neck compression check applies.
Puff on tall: base_score = 0.70 (tall absorbs puff proportionally — elegant).
Puff on apple + plus_size: base_score = 0.25 (combined upper body volume concern). Apple alone: 0.45.
Plus size puff + stiff fabric (drape < 0.3): -0.15 penalty ('armor effect').
Above-knee elongation = min(inches_above * 0.20, 0.60). Diminishing returns — first 3 inches most impactful.
Petite above-knee bonus = (63 - height) / 50. Up to +0.16 at 5'0. Each inch is larger % of total leg.
Tall above-knee diminishment: if leg_ratio > 0.62, elongation *= 0.65 (already-long legs benefit less); else *= 0.85.
Pear thigh exposure penalty: c_thigh > 27in -> -0.35; > 24in -> -0.20; > 22in -> -0.10. If goal='showcase', penalty *= 0.5. If goal='narrower', penalty *= 1.2.
Apple above-knee bonus: slim legs (c_thigh < 22in) -> +0.15; < 24in -> +0.08. Showcases apple's asset (slim legs).
Knee danger zone score: -0.30 base. Petite: -0.40. Bisects leg at joint, creates visual 'cut'.
Safe zone (between knee and calf dangers): sweet spot (25-75% through zone) = +0.30; near edges = +0.15. Tall bonus: +0.10.
Collapsed zone: when safe_zone_size < 0 (petite), score = -0.20. WARNING: no safe below-knee position exists.
Calf danger zone: base -0.35. If calf_prominence > 1.3: -0.50. If > 1.2: -0.42. Petite amplification: *= 1.15.
Calf danger radius = 1.0 + (calf_prominence - 1.0) * 3.0. More prominent calf = wider danger zone.
Below-calf score: +0.15. Past danger zones — shows narrow lower leg.
Ankle on petite: relaxed/oversized/tent silhouette -> -0.15 (volume overwhelms); bodycon/fitted + belt/high waist -> +0.40 (strong elongation); else +0.10.
Ankle on tall: +0.45 (elegant, proportional).
Ankle on hourglass without belt/waist definition: -0.15 (shape loss from hiding curves in column).
Floor length: tall +0.15; standard +0.05; petite -0.10 (drowning without heels).
Hemline height-scaling: hem_from_shoulder_adjusted = hem_from_shoulder * (body_height / model_height) when height difference > 2 inches.
Waist placement score: improvement = deviation_before - deviation_after from golden ratio (0.618). Score = improvement * 8.0, clamped to [-0.80, +0.80].
Empire + hourglass shape loss: standard fabric -> -0.30 penalty; drapey (drape>0.7) -> -0.15; stretchy (stretch>0.5) -> -0.10.

Empire + tall + short torso (torso_leg_ratio < 0.35): -0.25 penalty (worsens imbalance).
Drop waist + short legs (leg_ratio < 0.55): -0.30 penalty (dramatically shortens perceived legs). If < 0.58: -0.15.
Natural waist + apple + belt + WHR > 0.88: -0.30 penalty (belt highlights widest circumference). If WHR > 0.85: -0.15.
Short legs (leg_ratio < 0.55) + empire/high waist: +0.10 bonus on top of proportion improvement.

Dark color slimming: L*<=10: ~4% slim; L*<=25: ~3%; L*<=40: ~2%; L*<=60: ~0.5%; L*<=80: -0.5% (mild widening); L*>80: -1% (widening). Score conversion: slim_pct * 6.25.

Skin tone contrast modifier: skin_garment_contrast > 0.70 (fair skin + black) -> -0.05 (edges MORE visible); < 0.30 (dark skin + black) -> +0.05 (edges blend).

Neck length calibration: <= 2.0in = very_short (-1.0); 2.5in = short (-0.50); 3.0in = average (0.0); 3.5in = long (+0.50); >= 4.0in = very_long (+1.0).
Shoulder width calibration: <= 13.0in = very_narrow (-1.0); 14.0in = narrow (-0.50); 15.0in = average (0.0); 16.0in = wide (+0.50); >= 17.0in = very_wide (+1.0).
Arm width calibration (upper arm circ): <= 9.0in = slim (-1.0); 10.0in = below_average (-0.50); 11.5in = average (0.0); 13.0in = above_average (+0.50); >= 15.0in = full (+1.0).
Leg length calibration (visual leg as fraction of height): <= 0.52 = very_short (-1.0); 0.55 = short (-0.50); 0.58 = average (0.0); 0.62 = long (+0.50); >= 0.65 = very_long (+1.0).

Bust size calibration (bust differential): <= 2.0in = very_small (-1.0); 3.5in = small (-0.50); 5.0in = average (0.0); 7.0in = large (+0.50); >= 9.0in = very_large (+1.0).

Arm circumference profile modeled inch-by-inch from shoulder to wrist. Key landmarks: max upper arm position, forearm narrowest position, elbow at ~44% of arm length.
Anatomical zone mapping: shoulder_cap (0-2in), danger_zone (max_pos±1-1.5), upper_taper, elbow (±1in), forearm_taper, forearm_narrow (±0.5-1.5in), wrist_approach, wrist.
Arm circumference interpolation: between shoulder and widest = increasing; between widest and forearm narrowest = decreasing; between forearm narrowest and wrist = slight increase.
Width ratio computation: (c_at_termination - c_wrist) / (c_upper_arm_max - c_wrist). 0.0 = narrowest visible, 1.0 = widest visible.
Hemline computation engine: inputs are garment_length OR hem_position_label. Adjusts for height difference between model and user.
Danger zone overlap detection for petite: safe_zone_size = knee_danger_bottom - calf_danger_top. If negative, zones collapse.
Knee danger zone: knee_center ± (1.0 below, 1.5 above).
Calf danger radius: 1.0 + (calf_prominence - 1.0) * 3.0. Calf prominence = c_calf_max / c_calf_min.

name: Composite Scoring Architecture

steps.step_1: Call all 10 principle scorers independently. Each returns (score, reasoning_chain).
steps.step_2: Assign weights. Non-applicable principles -> weight 0. User's primary goal -> matching principles get x1.5. Strong negatives (< -0.15) -> x1.2 (conservative protection).
steps.step_3: Compute weighted average of applicable principles.
steps.step_4: Apply SILHOUETTE DOMINANCE RULE: if tent or bodycon scores < -0.20 AND user's goal is slimming, the composite CANNOT go positive. No amount of good color or pattern compensates for fundamentally wrong fit.

key_insight: Composite is CONSERVATIVE. Bad silhouettes cannot be fixed by good colors. But good silhouettes CAN be enhanced by good colors.

name: 5-Step Principle Scoring Pipeline

name: Score-to-Inches Conversion
description: Convert [-1,+1] score to perceived height change in inches.
formula: MULTIPLIER = 2.25 (revised from 2.75 after Contradiction #10). scale = max(0.75, min(1.20, 1.0 + (62 - user_height)*0.025)). perceived_inches = score * MULTIPLIER * scale.
uncertainty: +/-25% on all inch estimates. +1.0 inch prediction = +0.75 to +1.25 in practice.

name: Confidence Tier Weights
description: Every principle carries a confidence weight that determines contribution to final aggregated score. Higher confidence = more influence. Weight = confidence^2.

name: Positive Aggregation Method
description: Confidence-weighted average for positive principles. Weight = confidence^2 to emphasize high-confidence principles.
formula: weighted_sum = sum(score * conf^2). weight_total = sum(conf^2). positive_total = (weighted_sum / weight_total) * 2.5. Capped at 0.70.

name: Sabotage Aggregation Method (Product-Complement)
description: Sabotage penalties use product-complement stacking (diminishing returns). Each individual penalty capped at 0.40 before stacking.
formula: remaining = 1.0. For each penalty p (sorted largest first): remaining *= (1.0 - min(0.40, |p|)). sabotage_total = -(1.0 - remaining).
rationale: Product-complement ensures multiple small penalties compound realistically without exceeding -1.0, and diminishing returns mirror real perception.

name: Final Score Combination
description: Final score = positive_total + sabotage_total, clamped to [-1.0, +1.0]. Simple additive combination of positive (up to +0.70) and sabotage (down to -1.0).

name: Sabotage Interaction Matrix
description: Some sabotage penalties amplify or attenuate each other when co-occurring.
confidence_note: ALL 12 interaction values are geometric reasoning with ZERO empirical backing. Confidence: 25%. Most fabricated numbers in entire system.

name: Confidence Interval Calculation
description: Uncertainty on perceived inches based on average confidence of active components.
formula: uncertainty_pct = 0.55 - avg_confidence * 0.45. ci_low = perceived_inches * (1 - uncertainty_pct). ci_high = perceived_inches * (1 + uncertainty_pct). At avg_confidence 0.90: +/-15%. At avg_confidence 0.50: +/-40%.

rule: Red in India = purity, bridal, auspicious, fertility. Red in US = passion, danger, romance, boldness. Red at Indian wedding: +0.95 cultural score. Wedding guests avoid red to not overshadow bride: guest wearing red scores -0.30.

rule: White in India = mourning, loss, funerals, widowhood. White in US = purity, weddings (bridal), peace. White at Indian celebration is DEEPLY inappropriate.
scoring_impact: Indian celebration: cultural score = 0.05 (near-zero). US wedding: high cultural score.

rule: Black in India = bad luck, grief, evil eye. Black in US = sophistication, elegance, power. Gaining acceptance for Indian sangeet/reception but still cautious for ceremony.
scoring_impact: US evening: +0.90. Indian wedding ceremony: +0.20. Indian sangeet/reception: gaining acceptance.

rule: Gold in India = divine energy, prosperity, sacred. Central to Indian wedding embroidery. Red + gold = ultimate auspicious combo. Gold in US = luxury, glamour, holiday season.
scoring_impact: Indian wedding: gold embroidery essential. Red + gold combination: maximum cultural score.

rule: Saffron in India = purity, spiritual discipline, devotion. Worn by holy men. Represents Dharma. Temple associations. Saffron in US = autumn, warmth, Halloween.
scoring_impact: India religious context: high cultural resonance. India casual: still spiritual association.

rule: US professional: acceptable neckline depth <= 12cm from collarbone. Sleeveless acceptable in many offices.
scoring_impact: Depth > 12cm in US professional context: negative exposure score.

rule: US formal evening: acceptable neckline depth <= 30cm. Deep necklines, short hemlines standard. Any hemline length acceptable.
scoring_impact: US formal: wider exposure range acceptable.

rule: India professional: acceptable neckline depth <= 8cm. Hemline below knee. Upper arm coverage common. A well-draped cotton saree carries same authority as Western blazer.
scoring_impact: India professional: depth > 8cm triggers negative score. Sleeveless more restricted.

rule: India wedding ceremony: front neckline <= 10cm. Floor/ankle hemline. BACKS can be deep (<= 30cm back ok) - this is traditional.
scoring_impact: Deep front at Indian ceremony: negative. Deep back: culturally acceptable (traditional).

rule: India wedding reception: front neckline <= 18cm. More relaxed than ceremony. Embellishment expected.
scoring_impact: Reception more permissive than ceremony. Heavy embellishment positive.

rule: Saree is physics-based draping system (5-9 yards unstitched). Nivi style = vertical pleats (elongation). Bengali style = pallu across front (upper-body volume). Gujarati style = redistributes visual weight to right shoulder. Each must be modeled separately for body perception.
scoring_impact: Draping style fundamentally changes proportion scoring. Cannot use single saree model.

rule: Pallu creates visual proportion division (not hemline). Pallu to waist = ~60/40 split (good). Pallu to mid-thigh = ~50/50 (BAD). Pallu to knee = ~40/60 (good for elongation).
scoring_impact: Pallu position replaces hemline scoring for sarees. 50/50 split is worst.

rule: Thick contrasting borders widen at hemline; thin borders create cleaner vertical lines. Border-to-width ratio > 0.15 = significant widening penalty.
scoring_impact: Border ratio > 0.15: widening penalty applied to saree score.

rule: A 120 GSM cotton saree with heavy starch behaves like 200+ GSM structured fabric. Model: effective_gsm = gsm x (1 + starch_factor). Starch: none=0, light=0.3, heavy=0.7.
scoring_impact: Starch transforms fabric behavior. Must use effective_gsm in all fabric-dependent scoring.

rule: Lehenga waistline sits at hip (delta = -8 to -12cm). Scores 0.30 under standard waistline rules. MUST bypass standard waistline scoring entirely; use choli_length + skirt_flare_angle instead.
scoring_impact: Standard waistline scoring DISABLED for lehenga. Alternative: choli_length + skirt_flare.

rule: Kameez length relative to body creates the proportion division. Longer kameez shortens visual leg line; shorter kameez with churidar elongates it.
scoring_impact: Kameez length is the proportion-determining variable. Replace hemline logic.

rule: Kurti with jeans is the most common outfit for young Indian women. Casual context.
scoring_impact: Kurti-jeans is baseline casual; score relative to this norm for Indian casual occasion.

rule: A well-draped cotton saree carries the same authority as a Western blazer in Indian professional context.
scoring_impact: Cotton saree in India professional = professional score equivalent to Western structured garment.

rule: Indian formal events (sangeet, reception): heavy embellishment expected. A minimalist garment would underscore.
scoring_impact: Indian formal: embellishment_weight increases. Minimalist garment penalized.

rule: NEVER use ethnicity as proxy for undertone. South Asian b* ranges 8-35 covering warm, neutral, AND cool. A Tamil woman with b*=12 (neutral) is misserved by 'Indian = warm' assumption.
scoring_impact: Ethnicity-based undertone assumptions PROHIBITED. Must measure individual b* value.

rule: Cultural override is a MULTIPLIER, not replacement. Cool-toned user in red at Indian wedding still scores lower than warm-toned. When cultural > 0.85 AND undertone < 0.60: trigger shade_recommendation_mode (tomato red vs cherry red vs brick red).
scoring_impact: When cultural score is high but undertone match is poor: recommend specific shade within culturally appropriate color.

scoring_impact: Formal: silhouette dominates (0.20). Fit important (0.18). Comfort minimal.

rule: Indian wedding scoring goals: grandeur=0.30, cultural_fit=0.25, color=0.25, modesty=0.20. These REPLACE standard proportion-optimization goals.
scoring_impact: Cultural context shifts the GOAL, not just the score. Different goal weights for India wedding.

rule: Indian casual scoring goals: proportion=0.30, comfort=0.25, color=0.25, trend=0.20.
scoring_impact: Indian casual: proportion still important but comfort elevated vs Western casual.

rule: India is NOT single-climate. Chennai Jan: 24C. Delhi Jan: 7C. Delhi Jun: 42C. Monsoon (Jun-Sep) changes fabric behavior drastically. Temperate zones need month-dependent mode.
scoring_impact: Climate scoring must be region + month specific. Monsoon: fabric performance degrades.

rule: Kanjivaram silk in tropical India: comfort = 0.20 but wedding cultural_override = 0.95. Final = 0.80 x cultural + 0.20 x comfort = 0.80. Cultural overrides comfort for ceremonial garments.
scoring_impact: Ceremonial: cultural weight 0.80, comfort weight 0.20. Comfort does NOT veto cultural requirement.

rule: Each 2mm fabric layer adds ~0.4cm per side. 3 layers = 2.4cm wider total. CAN change body shape classification (e.g., pear -> rectangle if winter layers add more torso width than hip width).
scoring_impact: Winter layering can shift body type classification. Re-score after accounting for layer width.

rule: Women lose ~30% of skin collagen in first 5 years post-menopause (avg onset 51). Model uses step function at 50-55, not smooth curve. A 48yo and 56yo may have dramatically different fabric interactions despite 8 years apart.
scoring_impact: Step function at 50-55: fabric interaction parameters change sharply, not gradually.

rule: Body composition: waist_expansion = (age - 30) x 0.30%/year. At age 50: +6% waist circumference for same weight.
scoring_impact: Adjusts body measurements for age. Affects WHR-dependent scoring.

rule: Height loss: (age - 40) x 0.10 cm/decade.
scoring_impact: Adjusts height for age. Affects petite classification threshold over time.

rule: Muscle decline: -1.5%/year after age 50.
scoring_impact: Affects tissue compliance and body composition parameters.

rule: ABSOLUTE RULE: NEVER reference age in user-facing output. NEVER suggest longer sleeves based on age. Score the garment AS CHOSEN; offer fabric alternatives alongside.
scoring_impact: Language engine constraint. Age is internal scoring variable only, never surfaced.

rule: HRT, active weightlifting, genetics create 10-15 year variation in tissue compliance. Athletic 55yo may have better tissue than sedentary 35yo. MUST NOT use age alone - use tissue compliance from body scan; age is fallback (confidence = LOW).
scoring_impact: Tissue compliance from body scan preferred. Age-based estimation only as fallback.
confidence: LOW for age inference, MEDIUM for tissue scan

rule: India: indirectness_level = 0.75 (US = 0.50). Family shopping mode enabled by default (mothers/daughters share screens; avoid embarrassment). Regional templates in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Bengali - NOT translated from English (idioms differ).
scoring_impact: Language output must be more indirect for India market. Family viewing context assumed.

rule: Body shape categories BANNED from user output: 'apple', 'pear', 'hourglass', 'rectangle', 'inverted triangle'. Replace with specific proportion descriptions: 'Your shoulders are slightly narrower than your hips' (not 'You're a pear').
scoring_impact: Language constraint on output. Internal categories used for scoring only.

rule: BANNED: 'flatten/flatter your figure' (use 'complement your proportions'), 'hide/disguise/camouflage' (use 'balance' or 'shift visual focus to [X]'), 'problem area' (use 'area where garment construction matters most'), 'slimming' (use 'streamlined' or 'creates a clean vertical line'), 'you're pear/apple shaped' (use 'based on your shoulder-to-hip ratio'), 'at your age' (NEVER reference age), 'you can't/shouldn't wear' (use 'this works against [your stated goal]'), any reference to 'big' body parts (describe garment's visual EFFECT, never body's SIZE).
scoring_impact: Language engine constraint. All banned terms have required replacements.

rule: Score 0.85-1.00: Enthusiastic ('This [attribute] is going to create [specific positive effect] on you.'). 0.70-0.84: Positive+note ('This works well. For even more [goal], consider [alt].'). 0.50-0.69: Neutral+suggest ('This will [effect]. For [goal], [alt] would [improve].'). 0.30-0.49: Honest redirect ('This [detail] tends to [effect] because [physics]. [Alt] would [goal].'). <0.30: Clear skip+alt ('Skip this one - [physics reason]. [Alt] would [achieve the look].').
scoring_impact: Tone and template selection based on score range.

rule: US: height 5'3.5" (161cm), weight 171.8lbs (78kg), WHR ~0.83, BMI mean ~29.7, TLR ~0.95-1.00. India: height 5'3" (160cm) urban / 5'0" (152cm) overall, weight 55-65kg urban, WHR ~0.85+, BMI mean ~22-23 but 79% may have excess fat at lower cutoffs. Cannot use BMI as proxy for shape.
